conversation.message: Dear School_B Admissions, I’m Student_A and I’m applying because School_B is my first-choice school. I’m highly motivated to join your community and would enthusiastically accept an offer if admitted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B, so I should apply immediately. Although School_B ranks me last in its priority list, delaying would only reduce my chances further since other students (especially Student_B and Student_C) are also likely to apply there and are ranked above me. An early, clear application with a strong statement of fit is my best shot.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_A,

Thank you for your application and for sharing your strong interest in School_B. After reviewing applications in this round, we’re not able to offer you a seat at this time.

We appreciate your enthusiasm for our community and wish you the very best in the remainder of the process.

Sincerely,
School_B Admissions
conversation.thought: School_B has quota 1 and received APPLY messages from Student_A, Student_B, and Student_C in round 1. On School_B’s true priority list, Student_A is last, while Student_B is 2nd and Student_C is 3rd. Since accepting Student_A now would immediately finalize a match and exclude School_B from considering higher-priority applicants who are currently available and applying, it is optimal to reject Student_A and preserve the seat for a higher-ranked student.

conversation.message: Hello School_B Admissions Committee—I'm Student_B. School_B is one of my top choices because I value a strong academic environment and I believe I would be a committed, positive contributor to the school community. I would be excited to enroll if admitted. Thank you for your consideration.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_A, but School_A ranks me 4th, so I’m unlikely to be accepted if higher-priority students apply. School_B is my 2nd choice and ranks me 2nd, making acceptance very likely if I apply immediately. Securing School_B now maximizes my chance of a high-ranked match rather than risking rejection at School_A and losing School_B to competition.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_B,

Thank you for your application and for your thoughtful interest in School_B. We are pleased to offer you admission and a seat in our incoming class.

If you choose to enroll at School_B, we look forward to welcoming you to our community.

Sincerely,
School_B Admissions

[ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: We have quota 1. Our true priority ranking is E > B > C > D > A. In this round we received APPLY from A, B, C. E (our top choice) has not applied to us and, per preferences, ranks us last, so is unlikely to come. Between B and C, B is higher on our priority list. Also, Student_B ranks School_B as their 2nd choice (after School_A), so there is some risk they might match with School_A; however, accepting now secures a high-priority match and we cannot hold seats. Therefore accept Student_B and reject/forgo others.

conversation.message: Hello School_B admissions committee. I’m Student_C, and School_B is my first choice. I’m very motivated to enroll and would be excited to commit if offered a seat. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top true choice is School_B. I have relatively strong priority there (3rd), so applying immediately gives me a real chance to secure my first choice before higher-priority students fill the single seat.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_C,

Thank you for your application and for sharing your strong interest in School_B. At this time, we are not able to offer you a seat because our available capacity has been filled in this round.

We appreciate your interest in our community and wish you the very best in the remainder of the process.

Sincerely,
School_B Admissions

[REJECT]
conversation.thought: My quota is already filled (0 remaining) with Student_B, who is high on my true priority list (2nd). Per the rules, if quota is 0 I must reject any new [APPLY] messages. Student_C is also on my priority list (3rd), but I cannot accept without capacity, so I must reject now.

conversation.message: Dear School_C Admissions, I’m Student_D and I’m very interested in joining School_C this year. Your academic environment and opportunities are a strong fit for what I’m looking for, and I would be excited to commit if offered a seat. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B, but School_B’s priority ranks me 4th (behind E, B, C), so applying immediately is likely to be rejected if higher-priority students apply. School_C is my 2nd choice and ranks me 3rd (behind B, C), giving a better chance to secure a high-preference match early. I will apply to School_C now with a clear commitment to improve acceptance odds.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_D,

Thank you for your application and thoughtful note. We’re pleased to offer you admission to School_C. We believe you would be a strong fit for our academic community and opportunities.

We look forward to welcoming you to School_C.

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions
conversation.thought: School_C has quota 1 and true priority order is B > C > D > E > A. In this round, I received [APPLY] from Student_D and Student_E. Between these two, Student_D is ranked higher than Student_E on my list. However, Student_B and Student_C are ranked above Student_D; I should consider whether they are likely to apply to me soon. Student_B’s preferences place School_C as 3rd (after A, B), and Student_C’s preferences place School_C as 2nd (after B). That means Student_C is a plausible future applicant if rejected elsewhere, while Student_B may also come later. But there is no guarantee either will apply, and accepting Student_D now secures a relatively high-ranked candidate (3rd) and avoids the risk of ending with a lower-ranked match or no match. Since offers are binding and I must respond to an [APPLY] with accept/reject, I will accept Student_D and fill my quota with a strong option.

conversation.message: Dear School_C Admissions, I’m Student_E and I’m formally applying because School_C is my first-choice school. I’m highly motivated to join your community and would be excited to commit if accepted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top true choice is School_C, so I should apply immediately. Although School_C ranks me 4th, applying early maximizes my chance before they fill their single seat with higher-priority applicants. If rejected, I can move to School_D or School_A next rounds (where I have relatively better standing).

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for your application and for sharing that School_C is your first choice. We truly appreciate your interest.

At this time, our available seat has already been filled, so we’re unable to offer you admission in this round.

We wish you the very best with your remaining applications.

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions
conversation.thought: My quota is already filled (remaining quota = 0) with Student_D, and the rules require that I reject any new [APPLY] when quota is 0. Although Student_E is on my true priority list (ranked above Student_D), I cannot accept or renegotiate after a match is established in this simulation state. Therefore I must reject Student_E’s application this round.

conversation.message:
Dear School_A Admissions Committee,

I’m very excited about the opportunity to join your school community, and I’m confident I would contribute positively both academically and through extracurricular involvement. Thank you for your consideration.

Sincerely,
Student_A
conversation.thought: School_B (my #1) already rejected me, and School_C (my #2) is no longer available. From the remaining unmatched schools (School_A, School_D, School_E), School_A is my highest true preference (#3). Also, School_A’s priority list ranks me 3rd, giving me a realistic chance to be accepted if I apply now before the seat is taken. Therefore I will submit a strong, committed application to School_A.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_A,

Thank you for your application to School_A. We have reviewed your submission and are pleased to offer you admission. We would be excited to have you join our community.

Sincerely,

conversation.thought: School_A quota is 1. My true priority ranks Student_A as 3rd (behind Student_E and Student_D). Student_A’s preference list places School_A 3rd (after School_B and School_C), so even if I accept, there is some risk they would have preferred elsewhere, but in this protocol an [ACCEPT] with their [APPLY] forms a match immediately. In the current inbox, only Student_A applied, and leaving the seat open risks ending unmatched if higher-priority students never apply to me (Student_E ranks School_A 3rd; Student_D ranks School_A 3rd). Given the secure immediate match and no competing applicants this round, accept Student_A.

conversation.message:

Thank you very much for your consideration.

Sincerely,
Student_E

I also have relatively strong priority at School_D (4th), so a direct application now gives me the best chance to secure a high-ranked match before the seat is taken.

conversation.thought: School_D has quota 1 and true priority order: D > A > C > E > B. In this round, I have applications from Student_C and Student_E. Student_C is ranked higher than Student_E on my list, so accepting Student_E now would risk losing the chance to match with a higher-priority student who is currently applying. Therefore I should reject Student_E and preserve the seat for Student_C (or potentially Student_D/Student_A if they later become available).

conversation.message:

School_D’s priority list ranks me (Student_C) 3rd, giving me a realistic chance to secure the single seat if higher-priority students choose other schools. Since matching now is valuable and School_D is still a strong fit for me, I will submit a clear, committed application emphasizing fit and readiness to enroll.

conversation.message:
Dear School_E Admissions,

conversation.thought: As School_E, my true priority list is A > C > B > E > D. The only applicant in my inbox this round is Student_E, who is acceptable but ranked 4th. With quota 1 and no current matches, I should consider whether holding out could realistically yield Student_A/Student_C/Student_B later. Given Student_E’s preference list places School_E 4th (after C, D, A), they are applying now likely because other options are unavailable, suggesting they may commit if accepted. Meanwhile, Student_A ranks School_E 4th as well; Student_C ranks School_E 4th; Student_B ranks School_E last. It is uncertain higher-priority students will apply to me in remaining rounds, and rejecting now risks ending unmatched. Therefore, accept Student_E to secure a filled seat with an acceptable student.
